title: Build artwork data table with server-side pagination and persistent selection

requirements.text: Install and configure PrimeReact library with DataTable component support
acceptanceCriteria: PrimeReact is installed as a project dependency
PrimeReact theme CSS is imported in the application
DataTable component can be imported and used

requirements.text: Create TypeScript interface for artwork data matching API response structure with fields: id, title, place_of_origin, artist_display, inscriptions, date_start, date_end
acceptanceCriteria: TypeScript interface accurately represents artwork data structure
Interface includes all six required display fields plus id field
Types are properly defined for each field

requirements.text: Fetch artwork data from Art Institute of Chicago API endpoint https://api.artic.edu/api/v1/artworks?page=1 on initial page load

quotes: Fetch and display data from page 1 on initial load

acceptanceCriteria: API call is made to the correct endpoint on component mount
Data is fetched using the exact URL https://api.artic.edu/api/v1/artworks?page=1
Loading states are handled appropriately
Error states are handled appropriately

requirements.text: Display artwork data in PrimeReact DataTable with columns for title, place_of_origin, artist_display, inscriptions, date_start, and date_end

quotes: Display all required fields in the table

acceptanceCriteria: DataTable renders all six required fields as separate columns
Column headers are properly labeled
Data from API is correctly mapped to table rows
Table displays current page data only

requirements.text: Implement server-side pagination controls that fetch new data from API when user navigates between pages

quotes: Fetch data from API whenever user changes page
Must use server-side pagination (fetch data per page, not all at once)

acceptanceCriteria: Pagination controls are visible and functional
Changing pages triggers a new API request with updated page parameter
Only current page data is fetched (no bulk data fetching)
Pagination reflects total number of available pages from API

requirements.text: Add checkboxes for row selection supporting individual row selection and select-all for current page only

quotes: Allow selecting/deselecting all rows on current page

acceptanceCriteria: Each row has a selectable checkbox
Individual rows can be selected and deselected
Select-all checkbox toggles all rows on current page
Select-all only affects visible rows on current page

requirements.text: Create custom row selection overlay panel with input field allowing user to select N number of rows through numeric input

quotes: An Overlay panel which allows user to custom select n number of rows through input field

acceptanceCriteria: Overlay panel is accessible from the UI
Panel contains an input field for entering number of rows to select
Input accepts numeric values only
Panel has a submit/apply button to trigger selection

requirements.text: Implement persistent row selection using ID-based tracking strategy that maintains selection state across page navigation without prefetching or storing data from other pages

quotes: Selected/deselected rows must persist when navigating between pages
Do not fetch rows from other pages and store the objects or ids in a variable in order to select rows from other pages
Track selections separately - Store row IDs/keys of selected items, not entire row objects

acceptanceCriteria: Row selections persist when navigating away from and returning to a page
Selection state is maintained using row IDs only, not full row objects
No API calls are made to prefetch data from other pages
No storage of row objects from pages not currently displayed
Custom selection for N rows works across pages using ID-based strategy without fetching other page data

requirements.text: Handle custom row selection input where N exceeds current page row count using an ID-based calculation strategy that does not fetch or store data from other pages

quotes: If user selects rows more than the available rows in the current page through custom Row Selection, then you must not pre fetch next (other) page rows and store them in a variable
Instead, you must implement a strategy to handle custom row selection and deselection for rows across different page

acceptanceCriteria: When N exceeds current page rows, selection spans across pages without prefetching
No async loops fetching multiple pages are implemented
Selection logic calculates which IDs to mark as selected based on page structure and row count
Implementation avoids the forbidden pattern shown in assignment (no while loop with API calls)
Only current page data is fetched and displayed at any time

requirements.text: Apply a clean, professional design style with consistent colors, typography, and spacing suitable for a data-focused artwork gallery application
acceptanceCriteria: Color scheme is professional and enhances readability
Typography is consistent across all components
Layout provides clear visual hierarchy
Design complements the data table as primary focus

constraints: Do not use async loops or while loops that fetch data from multiple pages to populate selection
Do not store row objects or data from pages that are not currently displayed
Selection persistence must be achieved through ID-based tracking only
Do not fetch data from other pages when handling custom row selection
Only current page data should be fetched and stored at any given time
Must use PrimeReact DataTable component (no alternative table libraries)
nonGoals: Client-side pagination (fetching all data at once)
Storing full row objects for selection tracking
Prefetching pages in advance for selection purposes
Using table libraries other than PrimeReact DataTable
